instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime and no picture after bad Waterdamage
threads.message:
Hello,
i have problems with an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B. The board had bad water damage and no green light. I cut off the bad damaged Thunderbolt area, replaced the SMC and a lot of other stuff. Now it has a green light and turns on again. The remaining problem is that it beeps if i take the ram out (speakers are ok) but wont chime. Also it has no Picture and no Backlight (missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> ; i already exchanged  <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> and the LVDS witch were damaged too) Could it be an SMC Issue (bad soldering or maybe bad SMC ; but it has a green light after the SMC exchange)? At this point i´m stuck.
Thanks for any help!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime and no picture after bad Waterdamage
threads.message: Fist the chime! Voltage on CPUVcore????

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime and no picture after bad Waterdamage
threads.message: It is beeping so the CPU is alive. This one is probably going to suck. Make sure you have good RAM and try 1 slot at a time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime and no picture after bad Waterdamage
threads.message: Yes, Vcore is there at 1.113V. With no ram installed it beeps 1x every few seconds. I tried with different ram sticks and every Slot on its own. While testing i noticed, that the HDD makes clinking sounds at the beginning and stays spinning after that and that after a minute or two if i leave it running the ODD makes its "sound" (the sound that it normally makes at the beginning of every Startup directly before the chime) but still no chime. Could it be one of the sensor issues, where the cpu is running incredible slow? I set it aside and let it run now for a few hours and look if it chimes later maybe...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime and no picture after bad Waterdamage
threads.message: What do you mean by "cut off" the thunderbolt area?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime and no picture after bad Waterdamage
threads.message: I removed <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> and some caps near it and some more near <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> as these where burned so badly, that eg. <CHIP>U4910</CHIP> is missing 11 pads including the groundpad (the chip looked like a ball as i opened the machine the first time). So i thought that there is no hope for TB and that it would be better if no voltage is going in this circuit anymore. I did this after i restored the green light. After i "cut off" T29 the fan starts to spin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime and no picture after bad Waterdamage
threads.message: Well, at this point it can be anything that stops the board from finishing POST. Everything is alive else it would not beep. Corrosion somewhere or under SMC/PCH/CPU. Maybe remove firewire chip if there was crap there. Does not look very good at this point.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime and no picture after bad Waterdamage
threads.message: Could it still be affected from Thunderbolt? I "cut off" nearly everything from <SIGNAL>PP15V_T29</SIGNAL> but there is still a short on that line. Could it be a bad soldering on the SMC i exchanged? Firewire Chip and area looks pretty clean still but if nothing else helps i´ll remove that chip too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime and no picture after bad Waterdamage
threads.message: As I said this could be anything. Probably a short in the board from T29 rail. Bad SMC solder is possible, anything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime and no picture after bad Waterdamage
threads.message: Thank you for the help. If i have the time i´ll practice a bit with this one. Not everything is fixable but it was my first SMC exchange and it worked, so i learned from it...
